verses.verse: "I know <S%H3045><s%> that you can do <S%H3201><s%> all things, <S%H4209><s%> and that no purpose of yours can be restrained. <S%H1219><s%>

You asked, <S%H5956><s%> 'Who is this who hides counsel <S%H6098><s%> without knowledge? <S%H1847><s%>' therefore I have uttered <S%H5046><s%> that which I did not understand, <S%H995><s%> things too wonderful <S%H6381><s%> for me, <S%H3045><s%> which I didn't know.
You said, <S%H8085><s%> 'Listen, now, <S%H1696><s%> and I will speak; I will question <S%H7592><s%> you, <S%H3045><s%> and you will answer me.'
I had heard <S%H8085><s%> of you by the hearing <S%H8088><s%> of the ear, <S%H241><s%> but now my eye <S%H5869><s%> sees you. <S%H7200><s%>
Therefore I abhor <S%H3988><s%> myself, <S%H5162><s%> and repent in dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes. <S%H665><s%>"

It was so, <S%H310><s%> that after Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> had spoken <S%H1696><s%> these words <S%H1697><s%> to Job, <S%H347><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite, <S%H8489><s%> "My wrath <S%H639><s%> is kindled <S%H2734><s%> against you, <S%H8147><s%> and against your two friends; <S%H7453><s%> for you have not spoken <S%H1696><s%> of me the thing that is right, <S%H3559><s%> as my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job has. <S%H347><s%>

Now therefore, <S%H3947><s%> take to yourselves seven <S%H7651><s%> bulls <S%H6499><s%> and seven <S%H7651><s%> rams, <S%H352><s%> and go <S%H3212><s%> to my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job, <S%H347><s%> and offer up <S%H5927><s%> for yourselves a burnt offering; <S%H5930><s%> and my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> shall pray <S%H6419><s%> for you, <S%H5375><s%> for I will accept him, <S%H6440><s%> that I not deal <S%H6213><s%> with you according to your folly. <S%H5039><s%> For you have not spoken <S%H1696><s%> of me the thing that is right, <S%H3559><s%> as my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job has. <S%H347><s%>"

So Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> and Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> and Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%> went, <S%H3212><s%> and did <S%H6213><s%> what Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H1696><s%> them, <S%H3068><s%> and Yahweh accepted <S%H5375><s%> Job. <S%H6440><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> turned <S%H7725><s%> the captivity <S%H7622><s%> of Job, <S%H347><s%> when he prayed <S%H6419><s%> for his friends. <S%H7453><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> gave <S%H3254><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> twice as much as he had before. <S%H4932><s%>

Then came <S%H935><s%> there to him all his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and all his sisters, <S%H269><s%> and all those who had been of his acquaintance <S%H3045><s%> before, <S%H6440><s%> and ate <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with him in his house. <S%H1004><s%> They comforted <S%H5162><s%> him, <S%H5162><s%> and consoled him concerning all the evil <S%H7451><s%> that Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> had brought <S%H935><s%> on him. <S%H376><s%> Everyone also gave <S%H5414><s%> him a <S%H259><s%> piece of money, <S%H7192><s%> and everyone <S%H376><s%> a <S%H259><s%> ring of gold. <S%H2091><s%>

So Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> the latter end <S%H319><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> more than his beginning. <S%H7225><s%> He had fourteen <S%H702><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> sheep, <S%H6629><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> camels, <S%H1581><s%> one thousand <S%H505><s%> yoke <S%H6776><s%> of oxen, <S%H1241><s%> and a thousand <S%H505><s%> female donkeys. <S%H860><s%>
He had also seven <S%H7658><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> daughters. <S%H1323><s%>

He called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the first, <S%H259><s%> Jemimah; <S%H3224><s%> and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the second, <S%H8145><s%> Keziah; <S%H7103><s%> and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the third, <S%H7992><s%> Keren Happuch. <S%H7163><s%>

In all the land <S%H776><s%> were no women <S%H802><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> so beautiful <S%H3303><s%> as the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Job. <S%H347><s%> Their father <S%H1><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> them an inheritance <S%H5159><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> their brothers. <S%H251><s%>

After <S%H310><s%> this Job <S%H347><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> his sons, <S%H1121><s%> and his sons <S%H1121><s%>' sons, <S%H1121><s%> to four <S%H702><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>
So Job <S%H347><s%> died, <S%H4191><s%> being old <S%H2205><s%> and full <S%H7649><s%> of days. <S%H3117><s%>
